page.title: 11EAGLE VILLAGE
page.content: One and a half miles due east of North Scarle is Eagle.The village has been built above the twenty metre contour line.The highest point near Eagle is Slacks Hill which is thirty five metres above sea level.The village overlooks the valley of the River Trent. Eagle is a very old village.It dates back to at least Saxon times.It got its name from a Saxon word,aecle meaning an oak tree.Eagle is in the original Domesday book. In the twelth century King Stephen gave the manor of Eagle to the Knight Templars.They owned it until the fourteenth century.They were suppressed and the manor was given to the Knight Hospitallers.Then in the middle of the sixteenth century they were suppressed and it was given to the Earl of Rutland.
